pros: I really enjoy the opportunities to teach the students here at the school. We have a lot good professors with incredible knowledge and experience to share along with very knowledgeable and bright students.
cons: None. It's truly an honor to work with everyone and try to make a positive experience out of a great opportunity.

pros: Small campus community with great students who are eager to learn.
cons: It’s has its bad days but mostly great place to work and learn if you’re willing to adopt the campus culture/climate.

pros: Its a small university with less that 100 full-time employees so it is a team environment. The work environment is supportive and offers a non rigid work day. A yearly bonus can be obtained by working hard. I enjoy working with students to help them be successful.
cons: Traffic can be heavy to get to work and lunch locations off site can be a drive.

pros: Some excellent adjunct faculty. Students are generally mature and respectful.
cons: Many illegal and unethical practices being done. Leadership is totally inept and running the school into the ground and very soon out of business. Less than 200 undergraduates enrolled. As others have said, a totel degree-mill that should be closed.

pros: Some great people and amazing students
cons: No complaints by me, all works efficiently

pros: Remote working opportunity Nice co-workers
cons: Low employee retention Low pay Toxic climate

review_title: Small Team Environment Where You Can Grow
pros: I wanted a job where you are just not locked into doing a specific set of the same job duties and can be part of a team to make the organization successful. This job has been great to allow a diversity of work duties and they offer a bonus each year based on performance which I have received along with enjoying my job. I also really like that I support helping our students who end up graduating and getting some great jobs. About 15 holidays a year, two personal days a year, vacation is good and increases with service, 5% above my salary is added to my retirement, tuition waiver programs, good health care plan, yearly possible bonus, free parking
cons: Even though the Subsidized Health and Dental Plans are good, I wish there was more subsidization for the family plan

review_title: Being a Student Worker at Capitol
pros:
Depending on the department you work in, it can be great work experience if you've never had it.

Small school so you can build rapport with people.
cons:
Minimum wages
Can be boring if you care about pace

pros: Friendly staff. Energetic but free environment
cons: Nothing I can think off

pros: Flexible times, Quiet work environment, Fun

pros: There is nothing useful there

review_title: School that just doesn't try very hard to recruit
job_title: Graduate Enrollment Coordinator in Laurel, MD
pros:
Good work/life balance. At one time, we had Fridays off in the summer and worked a condensed work week. That was nice. 
Awesome group of students. You really couldn't ask for a more dedicated bunch of people. 
Great programs that are likely to get a student hired. An easy sell.
cons:
The leadership here was woefully terrible. They prided themselves on not advertising. That could have been the reason for low enrollment, which they complained about. We had numerous meetings about how to spread the word about Capitol's programs and NONE of the suggestions were ever used, no matter how inexpensive (or free!) they were. 

The pay is low here. Staring out here is one thing, but don't expect to get rich. Get experience and get out.

review_title: Run. Quickly. In the opposite direction.
pros: If you want a "comfy" job that doesn't take too much brain juice to get through the day, this is the place for you. If you're already retired, or if you're entry level, go for it!
cons: I can't tell people enough to stay away from this place. The name of the game here is nepotism, and it shows the second you step in the door - no one under the age of 35 works here and likes it. There are NO policies and procedures in place, HR is nonexistent, management is incompetent, uneducated, and absolutely in their own little world. You will never hear a "thank you" and you'll never get paid anywhere near what you're worth. Colleagues are both lazy and crazy. You wouldn't get on the Titanic knowing it was going down, would you???

pros:
- Plenty of on-campus positions for students to apply for.
- If you've never had a job it's a great place to start. Everyone wants you to succeed.
- All the offices are close to each other so if you need something it's not far.
- Small campus so you'll get to know everyone and everyone is extremely friendly (even on their worst days)
cons:
- Remote. It's about a ten minute bike ride to the nearest store however there are plenty of carryouts to order from.
- Felt like the upper management was completely separate from the office workers. They just sort of showed up and gave orders every now and then (this isn't technically a con, just an observation)

review_title: Place to be in order to learn in a modern environment, innovate, and make connections that are government affiliated.
job_title: Help Desk Support, Assistant in Laurel, MD
pros: It is similar to a great big family, since the campus is small and contained. You eventually get to know everybody or as many people as you need to know in your surroundings.
cons: Not too many employers (outside of Maryland, at least) know of its existence.

pros: I love the flexibility of taking my classes completely online to finish my degree.  The course work is challenging but beneficial for developing skills for the emerging career fields.
cons: I honestly have yet to experience any shortcomings with the university.
